Malaysia.retirement: Employee contributions to the Employees Provident Fund (EPF) shall be deducted at the statutory rate of 11% of monthly wages, with the Employer contributing 12%.
Malaysia.social: The Employee shall be registered under the Social Security Organisation (SOCSO) and the Employment Insurance System (EIS) as required by Malaysian law.
Malaysia.notice: Either party may terminate this agreement by providing written notice as follows: 1 month (service < 2 years), 2 months (2‚Äì5 years), 3 months (> 5 years).
Malaysia.leave: The Employee is entitled to 18 days of paid annual leave per calendar year, in accordance with the Employment Act 1955.
Malaysia.probation: The Employee shall serve a probationary period of 3 months, during which either party may terminate with 1 week's written notice.
Malaysia.workHours: Standard working hours are 8 hours per day, 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday.
Malaysia.governing: This agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Malaysia.
Malaysia.overtime: Non-exempt employees are entitled to overtime pay: 1.5x for weekdays, 2x for rest days, 3x for public holidays.
Malaysia.termination: Employer may terminate for cause including misconduct, habitual absence, or criminal conviction, in accordance with Section 14 of the Employment Act 1955.

United Kingdom.retirement: The Employer shall auto-enrol the Employee into a qualifying workplace pension scheme. Employer contribution: 3% minimum. Employee contribution: 5% minimum, as per The Pensions Regulator requirements.
United Kingdom.social: The Employee is subject to National Insurance Contributions (NICs) as determined by HMRC. The Employer shall deduct and remit Class 1 NICs from the Employee's salary.
United Kingdom.notice: Either party may terminate this agreement by providing written notice as follows: 1 week per year of service (minimum 1 week, maximum 12 weeks), in accordance with the Employment Rights Act 1996.
United Kingdom.leave: The Employee is entitled to 28 days of paid annual leave per calendar year (inclusive of 8 public holidays), in accordance with the Working Time Regulations 1998.
United Kingdom.probation: The Employee shall serve a probationary period of 6 months, during which either party may terminate with 1 month's written notice.
United Kingdom.workHours: Standard working hours are 37.5 hours per week, Monday to Friday. The Employee opts out of the 48-hour weekly limit under the Working Time Regulations 1998.
United Kingdom.governing: This agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of England and Wales.
United Kingdom.overtime: Overtime is not guaranteed. Where required, it shall be compensated through time off in lieu (TOIL) or at the Manager's discretion.
United Kingdom.termination: Employer may terminate for cause following a fair disciplinary procedure in accordance with ACAS Code of Practice.

Singapore.retirement: The Employer shall make monthly contributions to the Central Provident Fund (CPF) at the prevailing statutory rates: Employer 17%, Employee 20% (for employees aged ‚â§55).
Singapore.social: CPF contributions serve as the primary social security mechanism. The Employer shall comply with all CPF Act requirements.
Singapore.notice: Either party may terminate this agreement by providing 1 month's written notice, or salary in lieu thereof, in accordance with the Employment Act (Cap. 91).
Singapore.leave: The Employee is entitled to 14 days of paid annual leave per calendar year, increasing by 1 day per year of service up to 18 days.
Singapore.probation: The Employee shall serve a probationary period of 3 months, during which either party may terminate with 2 weeks' written notice.
Singapore.workHours: Standard working hours are 44 hours per week (9 hours/day for 5-day week), in accordance with the Employment Act.
Singapore.governing: This agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Republic of Singapore.
Singapore.overtime: Overtime pay is applicable under Part IV of the Employment Act for eligible employees at 1.5x the hourly basic rate.
Singapore.termination: Employer may terminate for cause including wilful breach of contract or misconduct, with or without notice per Section 14 of the Employment Act.

Germany.retirement: The Employee is enrolled in the statutory pension insurance scheme (Gesetzliche Rentenversicherung). Contributions are shared equally between Employer and Employee at the prevailing rate (currently 18.6%).
Germany.social: The Employee is subject to German social security contributions including health insurance, nursing care insurance, unemployment insurance, and accident insurance, as prescribed by the Sozialgesetzbuch (SGB).
Germany.notice: Either party may terminate this agreement by providing 4 weeks' notice to the 15th or end of a calendar month. Statutory notice periods increase with length of service per ¬ß622 BGB.
Germany.leave: The Employee is entitled to a minimum of 20 days paid annual leave (based on a 5-day week) per the Federal Leave Act (Bundesurlaubsgesetz). Company policy grants 28 days.
Germany.probation: The Employee shall serve a probationary period of 6 months, during which either party may terminate with 2 weeks' notice per ¬ß622(3) BGB.
Germany.workHours: Standard working hours are 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday, in accordance with the Working Time Act (Arbeitszeitgesetz).
Germany.governing: This agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Federal Republic of Germany.
Germany.overtime: Overtime shall be compensated through time off in lieu. Any overtime exceeding 10 hours/day is prohibited under the Arbeitszeitgesetz.

knowledgeBase.leavePolicy:
DERIV GROUP ‚Äî LEAVE POLICY SUMMARY (2026)

1. ANNUAL LEAVE: 18 days per year (pro-rated for new joiners). Carry forward max 5 days.
2. SICK LEAVE: 14 days paid. Hospitalization leave: 60 days. Medical certificate required for >2 consecutive days.
3. MATERNITY: 98 days (Malaysia). Varies by jurisdiction ‚Äî UK: 52 weeks, Singapore: 16 weeks.
4. PATERNITY: 7 days (Malaysia). UK: 2 weeks. Singapore: 2 weeks (government-paid).
5. COMPASSIONATE: 3 days for immediate family bereavement.
6. MARRIAGE: 3 days (one-time).
7. PUBLIC HOLIDAYS: Follow local jurisdiction calendar. Malaysia: 11 gazetted days.
8. NOTICE PERIOD: 1 month for <2 years service. 2 months for 2-5 years. 3 months for >5 years.
9. PROBATION: 3 months for all new hires. Notice period during probation: 1 week.
10. OVERTIME: Non-exempt employees only. 1.5x for weekdays, 2x for rest days, 3x for public holidays.
11. REMOTE WORK: 2 days/week hybrid for all eligible roles. Full remote requires VP approval.
12. EPF: Employee 11%, Employer 12% (Malaysia). UK: National Insurance contributions apply.
13. SOCSO: Employer contribution as per Employment Injury Scheme & Invalidity Scheme (Malaysia).

faqs.question: How many annual leave days do I get?
faqs.answer: All employees are entitled to 18 days of paid annual leave per year. New joiners receive pro-rated leave. You can carry forward up to 5 unused days to the next year.

faqs.question: What is the notice period?
faqs.answer: Notice periods depend on length of service: 1 month for less than 2 years, 2 months for 2-5 years, and 3 months for over 5 years. During probation, the notice period is 1 week.

faqs.question: How does remote work policy work?
faqs.answer: All eligible roles can work remotely 2 days per week under our hybrid policy. Full remote arrangements require VP-level approval and a formal remote work agreement.

faqs.question: What is the EPF contribution rate?
faqs.answer: In Malaysia, employees contribute 11% and employers contribute 12% of monthly wages to the Employees Provident Fund (EPF). For UK-based employees, National Insurance contributions apply instead.

faqs.question: How long is probation?
faqs.answer: Standard probation is 3 months for all new hires in Malaysia and Singapore. UK and Germany have 6-month probation periods. During probation, either party can terminate with shortened notice.

faqs.question: How do I apply for maternity leave?
faqs.answer: Notify your HR Manager and submit a medical certificate at least 4 weeks before expected delivery. Malaysia provides 98 days paid maternity leave. UK: up to 52 weeks (39 weeks paid). Singapore: 16 weeks (government-paid for qualifying mothers).

faqs.question: What happens when a visa expires?
faqs.answer: Visa renewals should be initiated at least 60 days before expiry. If a work permit expires without renewal, the employee cannot legally continue working. Contact HR immediately if your visa is expiring within 30 days.

faqs.question: What overtime rates apply?
faqs.answer: For non-exempt employees in Malaysia: 1.5x hourly rate for weekdays, 2x for rest days, and 3x for public holidays. Overtime must be pre-approved by your manager.

faqs.question: How do I generate a contract?
faqs.answer: Go to Contracts ‚Üí Generate New Contract. Select the contract type, jurisdiction, role, and salary. The AI will generate jurisdiction-compliant clauses automatically. Review, then print or save as PDF.

faqs.question: What is the company's GDPR policy?
faqs.answer: All EU employee data is processed under GDPR. For Malaysian operations, we comply with PDPA 2010. Data is encrypted at rest, access is role-based, and employees can request data export or deletion through Settings ‚Üí Privacy.
